  <h1>The Pav Bhaji recipe</h1>
<section>  
 <img src="data:image/jpeg;base64," alt="A picture of a delicious plate of Pav Bhaji"> <h3>Pav Bhaji is a popular Indian dish that combines a thick, spicy vegetable curry (bhaji) with soft, buttered bread rolls (pav). It's a staple food in Maharashtra, particularly Mumbai, and is often served as a street snack or a main dish. </h3>
 <h4>Ingredients</h4>
  <p><li>3 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed</li>

<li>4 medium tomatoes, finely chopped</li>

<li>1 cup green peas, boiled</li>

<li>2 medium onions, finely chopped</li>

<li>2-3 green chilies, finely chopped (optional, for heat)</li>

<li>1/2 cup capsicum (bell pepper), finely chopped</li>

<li>3 tbsp butter (yes, butter makes it better)</li>

<li>2 tbsp pav bhaji masala (available in Indian stores)</li>

<li>1 tsp red chili powder</li>

<li>1/2 tsp turmeric powder</li>

<li>Salt to taste</li>

<li>Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish)</li>

<li>Lemon wedges (to serve)</li>

<li>Pav buns (store-bought or homemade)</li>

<li>Butter for toasting pav buns</li>
 </section>
 <section>
<h4>1. Prepare Ingredients</h4>
<p><li>Gather potatoes, peas, tomatoes, spices, and oil.</li>

<li>Peel and dice the potatoes into small cubes for even cooking.</li>

<li>Chop tomatoes finely to blend well into the bhaji.</li>

<li>Measure out spices like cumin, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.</li>
</p>
<h4>2. Cook the Base </h4>
<p>
<li>Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.</li>

<li>Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle to release aroma.</li>

<li>Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and mushy.</li>

<li>Stir in turmeric, chili powder, and salt for flavor.</li>

</p>
<h4>3. Boil the Veggies</h4>
<p><li>In a separate pot, boil the diced potatoes and peas until tender.</li>

<li>Drain excess water to avoid watery bhaji.</li>

<li>Keep the boiled veggies warm until ready to combine.</li>

</p>
<h4>4. Mash the Veggies</h4>
<p><li>Add boiled potatoes and peas to the tomato and spice mixture in the pan.</li>

<li>Use a masher or spoon to mash them to your desired texture—mostly smooth but with some chunks.</li>

<li>Add water gradually if needed to adjust consistency.</li>

<li>Stir well and cook for a few minutes to let flavors blend.</li>

<li>Taste and adjust salt or spices as necessary.</li>

</p>
<h4>Final Step: Serve and Enjoy</h4>
<p><li>Transfer the prepared bhaji to a serving dish.</li>

<li>Garnish with fresh coriander or a squeeze of lemon for extra zing (optional).</li>

<li>Serve hot with your choice of bread (pav, roti, or naan) or rice.</li>

<li>Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 2 days.</li>

<li>Reheat gently before serving to keep the flavors fresh.</li></p>
 <h3>You’ve nailed it — simple, hearty, and ready to impress Pav bhaji! hope you found this recipe good share this recipe to others</h3>
 <h2>-By Ryan Tandon</h2>
